description.raw:
Make it easier to shutdown Gazebo with a single Ctrl-C.

The main change here is to move installation of the SIGINT handler to happen after initialization, just before we're ready to run (in both the server and the client).  A Ctrl-C delivered in the meantime will cause immediate program exit (default behavior for SIGINT).  As far as I can tell, that should be OK, and it gets rid of the most common hang-on-shutdown conditions, which happen when the user tries to exit after something has gone wrong (or taken too long) during initialization.

I also improved the process monitor in gazebo_main.cc.

And I removed some dead files that I found distracting.
